channel.title: Blog on Passwd.Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Passwd.Blog

item.title: Git: Installation and Setup for hugo.
item.description: Introduction This Git installation tutorial is very specific to deploying a hugo website to GitHub Pages using a custom domain. The hugo installation, setup and deployment tutorial can be found here. I will detail both Windows 10 and Ubuntu-19.10 setups. windows Windows 10 Setup Check if git is installed REM run the command from a dos prompt C:\>git usage: git [--version] [--help] [-C <path>] [-c <name>=<value>] [--exec-path[=<path>]] [--html-path] [--man-path] [--info-path] [-p | --paginate | -P | --no-pager] [--no-replace-objects] [--bare] [--git-dir=<path>] [--work-tree=<path>] [--namespace=<name>] <command> [<args>] .

item.title: Hugo: Installation, Setup and publishing to GitHub pages using a custom domain.
item.description: Introduction This post is somewhat meta, it describes my journey installing hugo, setting up Hugo on my authoring machines and publishing the site to GitHub pages using a custom domain. I will detail both Windows 10 and Ubuntu-19.10 setups. I found a lot of very good information on the web, but found it a bit fragmented and made a lot of assumptions, especially as far as git knowledge is concerned.
